text.section: The Department shall give notice and hold any hearing under this subtitle in accordance with the Administrative Procedure Act.

section.section: Within 10 days after being served with an order under § 9-335(a)(1) of this subtitle, the person served may request in writing a hearing before the Department.

If a request for a hearing is made under this subsection, the Department shall:
Hold the hearing within 10 days after receiving the request; and
Render a decision within 10 days after the hearing.

text.section: Within 10 days after being served with a notice under § 9-335(a)(2) of this subtitle, the person served may request in writing a hearing before the Department.
The Department may make a verbatim record of the proceedings of any hearing held under this subtitle.

section.section:
In connection with any hearing under this subtitle, the Department may:
Subpoena any person or evidence; and
Order a witness to give evidence.
A subpoenaed witness shall receive the same fees and mileage reimbursement as if the hearing were part of a civil action.

If a person fails to comply with a subpoena or order issued under this subsection, on petition of the Department, a circuit court, by order, may:
Compel obedience to the Department's order or subpoena; or
Compel testimony or the production of evidence.
The court may punish as a contempt any failure to obey its order issued under this section.
